metadata.name: Magic Items Dataset
metadata.description: Magical objects and elements from Grimms' Fairy Tales

golden_objects.text: Golden apples that attract magical creatures
Golden bird with feathers that grant wishes
Golden horse that runs as swiftly as the wind
Golden cage that triggers magical alarms when used
Golden ball that falls into a spring, initiating a magical encounter

magical_animals.text: Talking fox that offers counsel and reveals hidden truths
Enchanted frog that can retrieve items from depths
Talking horse that speaks truth even after death
Queen bee who can identify the true princess
Magical birds that perform impossible tasks for the protagonist

enchanted_objects.text: Cursed spindle that causes deep sleep upon pricking
Magic looking-glass that speaks truth and reveals the fairest in the land
Poisoned comb that causes unconsciousness upon contact
Magic wand that transforms people or objects
Enchanted lock of hair that speaks warnings to the true owner

magical_clothing.text: Invisibility cloak that allows wearer to follow unseen
Many-league boots that cover great distances quickly
Magical rings taken as tokens from entranced knights
Enchanted slippers that dance of their own accord
Cap of knowledge that grants wisdom to the wearer

magical_food.text: Poisoned apple with one deadly half
Water of life that heals mortal illness
Magic bread that quiets enchanted beasts
Inexhaustible loaf that provides endless food
White snake flesh that grants understanding of animal language

magical_weapons.text: Magic sword that can slay whole armies at a blow
Enchanted bow that never misses its target
Magic fiddle that compels the listener to dance uncontrollably
Iron wand that magically opens enchanted doors
Magic stick that breaks any lock it strikes

magical_helpers.text: Dwarfs who create magical items or perform impossible tasks
Elves who make shoes or clothes while humans sleep
Magical fish that grants wishes when spared
Enchanted prince disguised as a beast or animal
Fairy godmother who transforms ordinary objects
